messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 49 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: CVA6 RISC-V Virtualization: Architecture, Microarchitecture, and Design Space Exploration

Paper Abstract: Abstract Virtualization is a key technology used in a wide range of applications, from cloud computing to embedded systems. Over the last few years, mainstream computer architectures were extended with hardware virtualization support, giving rise to a set of virtualization technologies (e.g., Intel VT, Arm VE) that are now proliferating in modern processors and SoCs. In this article, we describe our work on hardware virtualization support in the RISC-V CVA6 core. Our contribution is multifold and encompasses architecture, microarchitecture, and design space exploration. In particular, we highlight the design of a set of microarchitectural enhancements (i.e., G-Stage Translation Lookaside Buffer (GTLB), L2 TLB) to alleviate the virtualization performance overhead. We also perform a Design Space Exploration (DSE) and accompanying post-layout simulations (based on 22nm FDX technology) to assess Performance, Power ,and Area (PPA). Further, we map design variants on an FPGA platform (Genesys 2) to assess the functional performance-area trade-off. Based on the DSE, we select an optimal design point for the CVA6 with hardware virtualization support. For this optimal hardware configuration, we collected functional performance results by running the MiBench benchmark on Linux atop Bao hypervisor for a single-core configuration. We observed a performance speedup of up to 16% (approx. 12.5% on average) compared with virtualization-aware non-optimized design at the minimal cost of 0.78% in area and 0.33% in power. Finally, all work described in this article is publicly available and open-sourced for the community to further evaluate additional design configurations and software stacks.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 49 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 49"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Bao: A Lightweight Static Partitioning Hypervisor for Modern Multi-Core Embedded Systems",
        "Virtualizing embedded systems - why bother?",
        "Denial-of-Service Attacks on Shared Cache in Multicore: Analysis and Prevention",
        "Virtualization on TrustZone-Enabled Microcontrollers? Voilà!",
        "ReZone: Disarming TrustZone with TEE privilege reduction",
        "Intel virtualization technology",
        "Isolation using virtualization in the Secure world Secure world software architecture on Armv8.4",
        "Instruction sets should be free: The case for risc-v",
        "Europe steps up as RISC-V ships 10bn cores",
        "Near-Threshold RISC-V Core With DSP Extensions for Scalable IoT Endpoint Devices",
        "HULK-V: a Heterogeneous Ultra-low-power Linux capable RISC-V SoC",
        "Vega: A Ten-Core SoC for IoT Endnodes With DNN Acceleration and Cognitive Wake-Up From MRAM-Based State-Retentive Sleep Mode",
        "Darkside: 2.6GFLOPS, 8.7mW Heterogeneous RISC-V Cluster for Extreme-Edge On-Chip DNN Inference and Training",
        "The Cost of Application-Class Processing: Energy and Performance Analysis of a Linux-Ready 1.7-GHz 64-Bit RISC-V Core in 22-nm FDSOI Technology",
        "Xuantie-910: A Commercial Multi-Core 12-Stage Pipeline Out-of-Order 64-bit High Performance RISC-V Processor with Vector Extension : Industrial Product",
        "Meet Monte Cimone: Exploring RISC-V High Performance Compute Clusters",
        "The RISC-V Instruction Set Manual Volume II: Privileged Architecture, Document Version 1.12-draft",
        "Embedded Hypervisor Xvisor: A Comparative Analysis",
        "Trap-less Virtual Interrupt for KVM on RISC-V",
        "seL4 is verified on RISC-V!",
        "Xen on ARM: System Virtualization Using Xen Hypervisor for ARM-Based Secure Mobile Phones",
        "Static Hardware Partitioning on RISC-V–Shortcomings, Limitations, and Prospects",
        "A First Look at RISC-V Virtualization from an Embedded Systems Perspective",
        "Development of a NOEL-V RISC-V SoC Targeting Space Applications",
        "SHAKTI Processors: An Open-Source Hardware Initiative",
        "RISC-V ”stimecmp / vstimecmp” Extension Document Version 0.5.4-3f9ed34",
        "Formal Requirements for Virtualizable Third Generation Architectures",
        "Ara: A 1-GHz+ Scalable and Energy-Efficient RISC-V Vector Processor With Multiprecision Floating-Point Support in 22-nm FD-SOI",
        "RISC-V Base Cache Management Operation ISA Extensions Document Version 1.0-fd39d01",
        "The RISC-V Advanced Interrupt Architecture Document Version 0.3.0-draft",
        "Shedding Light on Static Partitioning Hypevisros for Mixed-Criticality Systems",
        "SD-VBS: The San Diego Vision Benchmark Suite",
        "Lazy Load Scheduling for Mixed-Criticality Applications in Heterogeneous MPSoCs",
        "Designing Mixed Criticality Applications on Modern Heterogeneous MPSoC Platforms",
        "OpenPiton: An Open Source Manycore Research Framework",
        "A survey of microarchitectural timing attacks and countermeasures on contemporary hardware",
        "The Rocket Chip Generator",
        "GRLIB IP Core Users Manual",
        "Two New Techniques Integrated for Energy-Efficient TLB Design",
        "CoLT: Coalesced Large-Reach TLBs",
        "Tradeoffs in Supporting Two Page Sizes",
        "Increasing TLB Reach by Exploiting Clustering in Page Translations",
        "Efficient Address Translation for Architectures with Multiple Page Sizes",
        "Rethinking TLB Designs in Virtualized Environments: A Very Large Part-of-Memory TLB",
        "Going the Distance for TLB Prefetching: An Application-driven Study",
        "Shared Last-level TLBs for Chip Multiprocessors",
        "Scalable distributed last-level tlbs using low-latency interconnects",
        "Translation Caching: Skip, Don’t Walk (the Page Table)",
        "Accelerating Two-Dimensional Page Walks for Virtualized Systems"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 49 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in CVA6 RISC-V Virtualization: Architecture, Microarchitecture, and Design Space Exploration, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
